intro: Euphrasia minima var. alba, commonly known as the white lesser eyebright, is a small herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, hairy stems and small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its potential health benefits.
